title: Fever, weight loss, and recurrent infections in a young woman

initial_presentation.chief_complaint: Fever, sinus symptoms, cough, nausea, vomiting
initial_presentation.summary: 10-day febrile illness with months of night sweats, weight loss, and recurrent URI symptoms

full_case.history: 5 months of recurrent URI symptoms, night sweats, weight loss, prior ITP in adolescence
full_case.labs: pancytopenia, low total protein, normal albumin

gold_standard.problem_representation: 31-year-old woman with recurrent infections, lymphadenopathy, weight loss, and hypogammaglobulinemia concerning for primary immunodeficiency

differential.name: Common Variable Immunodeficiency
differential.why_fits: recurrent infections, low gamma globulins, granulomatous disease
differential.why_not: age of onset later than typical but still possible

differential.name: Disseminated fungal infection
differential.why_not: lab pattern and chronicity less consistent

teaching_points: recurrent infections + low globulin gap suggests immunodeficiency
constitutional symptoms do not always mean malignancy
